content.description:
NASA Astronaut Mae Jemison, 1992

Photo by HUM Images/Universal Images Group via Getty Images

American engineer, physician, and NASA astronaut. She became the first Black woman to travel in space when she served as an astronaut aboard the Space Shuttle Endeavour.
content.question: The image best reflects the legacy of which of the following?

choices.label: The advocacy of the Tuskegee Institute, which trained African American pilots during the first half of the twentieth century.
The efforts of activists who advocated for Black women’s integration into American society
The work of the Armed Forces, which supported equity during the Black Freedom movement
The goals of the pan-African movements, which championed industrial, political, and educational advancement

content.answer: The efforts of activists who advocated for Black women’s integration into American society

topic.text: 3.8: Lifting as We Climb: Uplift Ideologies and Black Women's Rights and Leadership

skill.text: 1.C: Identify and explain patterns, connections, or other relationships (causation, changes, continuities, comparison).
